cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to grammar and basic vocabulary of Swahili. Emphasis on comprehension and oral practice. Reading of selected texts. Relation of the language to its East African cultural context.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introductory Swahili

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This is an online asynchronous course. Students will require a headset in addition to a computer with internet access.

sections.name: LEC0101
sections.subTitle: Revolution, Decolonization and Social Change in the Caribbean

notes.name: Section Note
notes.content:
Note: Course will be offered synchronously online at the meeting times listed.
Online - Synchronous - See Timetable Instructions

cmCourseInfo.description: An upper level course. Topics of study vary from year to year.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics in Caribbean Studies

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This is an online synchronous course. The course will meet online at the times specified.

cmCourseInfo.description: Explores some important connections between Cognitive Science and Buddhism. In particular it will examine the insights of cognitive science into central Buddhist concepts such as wisdom, mindfulness, meditation, insight and self-control, as well as related concepts such as flow and mystical experience.
cmCourseInfo.title: Buddhism and Cognitive Science

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This is an online, hybrid course. Lectures will be pre-recorded and delivered asynchronously. Students will participate in live Q&As, course discussions and office hours during class time (Tuesdays & Thursdays 1:00 - 4:00 p.m.). Students will require access to Zoom.

cmCourseInfo.description: In recent years, the effects of meditation on the body have been widely researched. There is an increasing body of evidence that mindfulness meditation can affect brain activity, brain structure, neurochemistry and other psychobiological processes (e.g. blood pressure, cardiac function). This course will examine the research in this emerging field.
cmCourseInfo.title: Meditation and the Body

cmCourseInfo.description: Examines theories and practices that promote the building of cooperative, non-violent communities. Grounded in a series of historical cases studies, the course critically considers Gandhian principles and the ways in which these have been translated into collective action.
cmCourseInfo.title: Social Change and Non-Violence
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: NEW240Y1 and an additional 0.5 Equity Studies Core Group 300+ level course
